result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary R. Mendyke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $100 plus costs.  Cash bond to be applied. Balance due within 60 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary R. Mendyke

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zachary R. Mendyke in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State files Amended Information. 
  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Rushevics received a copy of the Amended Information and waives its reading. 

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes and there has been no request for restitution. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2 of the Amended Information.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Isherwood makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Rushevics makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 2 - 
Pay fine of $100 plus costs to include the misdemeanor DNA surcharge.
to Withdraw and Proposed Order to Withdraw (unsigned)
Motion hearing on May 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

State files the information.

Atty Rushevics has received a copy of the information and waives reading.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters NOT GUILTY pleas.

Bond is ordered continued.

Defendant Zachary R. Mendyke in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:45 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.
Atty Knaapen appears for Atty Isherwood.

Atty Knaapen states that the Defendant will be waiving his right to preliminary hearing.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Zachary R. Mendyke in court with attorney Maris Rushevics. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
